entities.name: Ice Cream Machine
entities.description: In this tutorial, you will learn about our controls like Generic Tiles, Micro Charts, and Process Flow.
samplesAsSteps: KPI Tile and Chart Tile in Start Page
Navigating from the Start Page to Other Pages
Header Container and Radial Micro Chart

samples.name: Process Flow
samples.description: Process Flow is a complex control that enables you to display documents or other items in their flow (fixed position).

samples.name: Scrollable Process Flow
samples.description: Process Flow is a complex control that enables you to display documents or other items in their flow (smaller place with scrolling enablement).

samples.name: Process Flow with Aggregated Nodes
samples.description: This sample shows the Process Flow control with aggregated nodes. You can use aggregated nodes to represent semantically equal nodes in the same path of your process flow (smaller place with scrolling enablement).

samples.name: Multiple Root Nodes
samples.description: This sample for Process Flow shows the case where multiple root nodes are used. In this case, the layout can be optimized. This sample is built with sap.m.Page control.

samples.name: Process Flow Merged Lanes
samples.description: This sample shows the Process Flow control with merged lanes and update of nodes.

samples.name: Process Flow Update Lanes
samples.description: This sample shows the Process Flow control with an update of lanes.

samples.name: Process Flow with Connection Labels
samples.description: This sample shows the Process Flow control with connection labels.

samples.name: Process Flow Node as Container
samples.description: This sample shows the Process Flow node being used as container.

samples.name: Process Flow with Image Content
samples.description: This sample shows the Process Flow node container with custom image content.

samples.name: Basic
samples.description: Provides an overview of the available layout options and features, such as grouping, filtering, sorting, and search. This sample uses JSON data binding.

samples.name: OData Binding
samples.description: Shows how to use OData model binding.

samples.name: Scrolling
samples.description: Demonstrates the Lazy Loading feature that preloads posts as you scroll along the timeline axis.

samples.name: Responsive Post Height
samples.description: Shows how the number of visible lines in timeline posts can be adjusted automatically based on screen resolution.

samples.name: Custom Grouping
samples.description: Shows a custom grouping function that groups posts by the first or second half of the year.

samples.name: No Binding
samples.description: Shows a timeline where no data binding is used.

samples.name: ChartContainer - Simple Toolbar
samples.description: Shows a chart with a toolbar including a button for showing or hiding the legend, zoom buttons, and a fullscreen button.

samples.name: ChartContainer - Integration of an external toolbar
samples.description: Shows a chart with an external toolbar (provided by the application) and with one option Dimension Switch control.

samples.name: ChartContainer - Simple Toolbar with FixFlex Layout
samples.description: In addition to the basic features like zoom and legend, this sample shows a chart with responsive height (instead of fixed height) in ChartContainer. For this sample, the FixFlex layout is used.

samples.name: ChartContainer - Toolbar with Dimension Switch and Different Types of Charts
samples.description: In addition to the basic features like zoom and legend, this sample shows a selection of different types of charts. For each chart, different dimensions can be chosen.

samples.name: ChartContainer - Toolbar with Dimension Switch and Customizable Icons
samples.description: In addition to the basic features like zoom and legend, this sample shows one type of a chart with various dimensions. The toolbar can be enhanced with icons by the user to switch to related content.

samples.name: ChartContainer - SelectionDetails with list actions and item actions
samples.description: Shows actions in SelectionDetails popover on the list level as well as on the item level.

samples.name: ChartContainer - SelectionDetails with list action groups
samples.description: Shows action groups in SelectionDetails popover on the list level.

samples.name: Status Indicators
samples.description: Shows status indicators that use different types of shapes and different animation settings. To preview how a status indicator's percentage value affects the status indicator's appearance, type a value between 0 and 100 into the 'Value' field and click 'Update Status'.

samples.name: Status Indicators Filled at an Arbitrary Angle
samples.description: Shows status indicators that use linear filling at different angles. To preview how a status indicator's percentage value affects the status indicator's appearance, type a value between 0 and 100 into the 'Value' field and click 'Update Status'.

samples.name: Status Indicators with Circular Filling
samples.description: Shows status indicators that use circular fill. To preview how a status indicator's percentage value affects the status indicator's appearance, type a value between 0 and 100 into the 'Value' field and click 'Update Status'.

samples.name: Status Indicators Using Semantic Colors
samples.description: Shows status indicators with semantic colors. To preview how a status indicator's percentage value affects the status indicator's appearance, type a value between 0 and 100 into the 'Value' field and click 'Update Status'.

samples.name: Status Indicators Sizes
samples.description: Shows status indicators of different sizes. To preview how a status indicator's percentage value affects the status indicator's appearance, type a value between 0 and 100 into the 'Value' field and click 'Update Status'.

samples.name: Status Indicators Choreography
samples.description: Shows content choreography features available for status indicators. This sample demonstrates how you can create a status indicator with different shapes that are filled in parallel, serial, and semi-parallel modes.

samples.name: Status Indicators Shapes Library
samples.description: Shows predefined shapes available from the shapes library.

samples.name: Basic
samples.description: A basic network graph with a graph overview.

samples.name: Force-Based Layout with Static Nodes
samples.description: A force-based layout network graph with various sets of static nodes.

samples.name: Org Chart
samples.description: An organizational chart with dynamic loading.

samples.name: Custom Layout
samples.description: A network graph with custom layout.

samples.name: Custom Layout with Background Image
samples.description: A custom layout network graph placed over a background image.

samples.name: Customization
samples.description: Provides basic examples of node customization.

samples.name: Node Dimensions
samples.description: Shows how different dimension attributes affect the node's appearance.

samples.name: Legend
samples.description: Provides an example of legend customization.

samples.name: Width and Height
samples.description: Provides examples of width and height settings.

samples.name: Custom Colors and Custom Statuses
samples.description: Provides an example of using custom colors by assigning custom statuses to nodes, lines, and groups of nodes.

samples.name: Custom rendering
samples.description: Provides an example of using custom node rendering.

samples.name: Bidirectional Custom Collapsing
samples.description: Provides an example of creating bidirectional custom collapsing with single level expansion. This sample also demonstrates usage of Dijkstra's algorithm for visualization of shortest path between two selected nodes.

samples.name: Swim Lane Layout
samples.description: Provides an example of a network graph where the nodes are arranged into swim lanes.

samples.name: Two Columns Layout
samples.description: Provides an example of a network graph where the nodes are arranged into two columns with support for nested groups.

samples.name: Network Graph with No Data
samples.description: Shows how a network graph looks in cases when there is no data to display.

samples.name: Micro Process Flow
samples.description: Provides basic examples on how you can use the micro process flow control.

samples.name: Micro Process Flow with a Popover
samples.description: Shows a micro process flow with a custom popover assigned to its nodes.

samples.name: Micro Process Render Type
samples.description: Shows micro process flow controls with different render type settings applied.

samples.name: Micro Process Flow in a Smart Table
samples.description: Shows a micro process flow control used in a smart table.

samples.name: Calculation Builder
samples.description: A basic calculation builder with a visual editor, a text editor, and two toolbars, providing operators, variables, and most common functions.

samples.name: Calculation Builder with a Custom Function
samples.description: A calculation builder with a custom function and custom validation on the expression level and on the function level.

samples.name: T Account
samples.description: A customizable panel with T accounts and T-account groups.

samples.name: Image Editor Container
samples.description: Shows an image editor inside an image editor container with a customized toolbar and custom size items.

samples.name: Image Editor Container in a Dialog
samples.description: Image editor container inside a full-screen dialog.

samples.name: Using Circular Crop in the Image Editor
samples.description: Shows how to crop images to circular or oval shapes.

links.desc: This demo app created with the 'Ice Cream Machine' tutorial contains various controls, including Generic Tiles, Micro Charts, and a Process Flow.
